description: First attested between 1350 and 1400 from Middle English diabolik, from Middle French diabolique, from Late Latin diabolicus, from Ancient Greek διαβολικός (diabolikós, “devilish”), from διάβολος (diábolos, “devil”).

adjectives.description: diabolic (comparative more diabolic, superlative most diabolic)

entries.meaning: Showing wickedness typical of a devil.

examples: fires lit up a diabolic scene
